text:
hi guys welcome to Pai's Thailand food blog where 
I show you everyday Thai food culture through all

the things that I eat on a regular basis so this 
morning we went to the market and we got some

supplies for making a Batman L Ratna is noodles 
rice noodles right here with gravy I have a

video recipe for this that I just posted but this 
version my grandma made the gravy uses broccoli

instead of Chinese broccoli Oh in addition to 
Chinese broccoli because I think we didn't have

enough and then in addition to pork we also have 
these pork balls just and there's also shrimp so

you know the point the moral of this story is you 
can make ratna using other vegetables or other

protein if you want or work with whatever you 
have and of course the condiment that I talked

about that you need to always have with Hrodna 
is the pickled chilies with white vinegar and

then for dessert we're later going to have this 
also we got from the market this morning this

is sticky rice that's been wrapped in banana leaf 
and grilled and it's got a filling how do I open

this it's got a filling don't ah so it's filled 
with banana or taro depending on which one you

can see the grilling actually got to the sticky 
rice a little bit so it does have a really nice

grilled aroma so the middle this one is banana 
filling there you go this is called cono ping

one of my favorite street food and that is all 
for our lunch today and for dinner today we got

most of our stuff from the market that we went to 
this morning so to start out is our appetizer our

fish cakes or Totman black now they try this but 
what we did is we bought the fish mix raw and then

we fried it ourselves so we can have it fresh now 
I have a shrimp version of this thing so you can

take a look it's basically fish and red curry 
paste the next up is northern food for a change

so I went to a stall that sold northern route so 
this is skank Emily or a curry with pork and it's

stewed for hours and hours with lots of spices 
it's very very good next to it is also northern

food this is northern lab so if you know a lab 
the north eastern style this is very different

it's not it doesn't have any lime juice and it's 
got a ton of all sorts of different spices this

is ground pork by the way and so it's yeah it's 
a very very different thing also very very good

next up is chicken feet chicken feet soup in 
five-spice flavored soup type thing now I don't

like chicken feet so I won't be eating this and 
tofu very simply the next thing also came from

the market though my grandmother made the feet 
by the way this is cow cow Moo without the cow

and this raises it's supposed to be rice with pork 
like stew but we just bought the pork separately

without the rice so that's what it is it's also 
cooked with soy sauce and lots of spices and then

next up our seafood for the day the very simply 
fried fish so fish salt fried that's pretty much

it it was just a lot better than it sounds and 
then just a little bit of sticky rice because we

have northern food today so we're gonna have 
sticky rice because that's you know what we

usually eat northern food with and that is all 
for today's lots of food because we have lots

of people today so stay tuned for dessert so you 
a lot of people know mango and sticky rice the

infamous Thai dessert but do you know there's one 
more thing that we like to eat with sticky rice

and that is durian and sticky rice that's what 
we're having today so the sticky rice is exactly

the same as the mango okay it I have a recipe 
for that and the stuff that we pour on top of it

however is this durian stinky yummy fruit and it's 
just flesh that's been cooked just very slightly

sometimes not cooked at all in this coconut syrup 
and then how you eat it is just take that and pour

it all over and it become sort of like a soup 
now if you can't stand during this must look

disgusting to you but if you love durian this is 
very very good and then the sticky rice just sort

of becomes mixed into this kind of like a rice 
pudding rice soup typing okay moving on this one

also from the market this morning is steamed and 
then grilled cassava root also known as yuca or

manioc okay and then it's served with this coconut 
and palm sugar syrup and this is cold right now so

it's a bit thick so when we heat it up it'll be 
thinner and it's a very simple thing it's this

is grilled and then you pour syrup over it but 
it's very very good once again this is one of my

absolute favorite things to eat from the market 
and that concludes my walk for today bye bye
